variants.Description in input context: c.248G>A (p.G83D) - This variant causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line. Cells were transfected with plasmids containing either wild-type or mutant TP53 cDNA.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot analysis revealed a significant reduction in TP53 protein levels (approximately 60% decrease) compared to the wild-type control in cells transfected with the mutant construct.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed to assess the reproducibility of the observed protein level changes.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate on the same gel to minimize technical variation.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells transfected with a plasmid expressing wild-type TP53 cDNA served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control to rule out any artifacts caused by plasmid transfection itself.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test was used for statistical analysis to determine significant differences between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% of the wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% of the wild-type control.
